title: 111_hr1109
content: The Act is titled the "Wild Monongahela Act: A National Legacy for West Virginia's Special Places" and designates wilderness in the Monongahela National Forest in West Virginia. The "Wild Monongahela Act: A National Legacy for West Virginia's Special Places" designates certain Federal lands within the Monongahela National Forest in West Virginia as wilderness, adding new components to the National Wilderness Preservation System. This includes the Big Draft Wilderness comprising approximately 5,144 acres and the Cranberry Expansion Wilderness comprising approximately 11,951 acres. Certain Federal land comprising approximately 7,156 acres will be added to the Cranberry Wilderness and administered as part of the Dolly Sods Wilderness. Additionally, approximately 698 acres will be added to the Otter Creek Wilderness. Certain Federal land totaling around 6,792 acres will form the Roaring Plains West Wilderness, while another 6,030 acres will become the Spice Run Wilderness. The Secretary of Agriculture will file maps and legal descriptions with relevant committees after the enactment of this Act. The Secretary of Agriculture will file maps and legal descriptions of designated wilderness areas with relevant committees for public inspection. The maps and descriptions will have the same legal effect as if included in the Act, with the Secretary authorized to correct errors. The Federal lands designated as wilderness will be administered in accordance with the Wilderness Act. The Secretary may authorize a competitive running event near designated wilderness areas in a manner compatible with preservation. The effective date of the Wilderness Act for designated federal lands is the enactment date of this Act. State jurisdiction over wildlife and fish in West Virginia is not affected by this section. SEC. 3. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT, LAUREL FORK SOUTH WILDERNESS, MONONGAHELA NATIONAL FOREST. The boundary of the Laurel Fork South Wilderness in Monongahela National Forest is modified to exclude two parcels of land. The federally owned land within the modified boundary will continue to be managed by the Secretary of Agriculture in accordance with the Wilderness Act. Additionally, the Monongahela National Forest boundary is confirmed. SEC. 4. Monongahela National Forest boundary confirmed to include specified tracts of land depicted on a map dated March 13, 2008. Federal lands within the boundary managed under National Forest System laws and regulations. Boundaries considered as of January 1, 1965 for Land and Water Conservation Fund purposes. SEC. 5. Enhanced trail opportunities. The Secretary of Agriculture, in consultation with interested parties, will develop a plan for nonmotorized recreation trail opportunities in the Monongahela National Forest. A report on the plan's implementation, including priority trail identification, must be submitted to Congress within two years. Consideration will be given to converting forest roads for recreational use. The Secretary of Agriculture may consider converting Forest Service roads in the Monongahela National Forest to nonmotorized uses for recreational opportunities.
